byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

abstract: Democrats on special Congressional committee to reduce nation's debt throw their support behind a plan that they say incorporates some ideas discussed by Pres Obama and House Speaker John A Boehner; proposal has virtually no chance of winning approval from Republicans on the committee, who have repeatedly said they will not accept a package that includes tax increases.
snippet: A proposal by members of a Congressional committee assigned to reduce the nation’s debt draws on ideas negotiated by President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner last summer.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction

lead_paragraph: A proposal by members of a Congressional committee assigned to reduce the nation’s debt draws on ideas negotiated by President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner last summer.

headline.main: Democrats’ First Offer: Up to $3 Trillion for Debt
headline.print_headline: Democrats’ First Offer: Up to $3 Trillion for Debt
headline.seo: Democrats Offer Up to $3 Trillion to Cut Debt
